MajorClaims.MC1: individuals should pay their college tuition
MajorClaims.MC2: the individual should finance his or her education

Claims.C1: it would cost too much, the college education is a personal's choice, and there are many ways to fund a college education
Claims.C2: it would cause too much cost from taxpayers and the governmen
Claims.C3: making college education free would cost too much
Claims.C4: those people should make the financial investment in their own choice; not the government
Claims.C5: there are many ways to fund a college education

Premises.P1: it would affect all taxpayers whether or not they benefit from the use of the funds
Premises.P2: It would divert public funds from other needs such as law enforcement, infrastructure and so forth
Premises.P3: There are many other needs which should come first, such as providing health care to all American, or improving public schools
Premises.P4: it would cause to raise our taxes again and again to fund college education
Premises.P5: it is a personal choice to go to a college
Premises.P6: Not everyone wants to go to a college
Premises.P7: People who want to make more money, and live a better life than other people decide to take a college education
Premises.P8: People who cannot afford to pay their tuition benefit from the scholarship, financial aids, and other funds
Premises.P9: the government already helps pay college expense through indirect means
Premises.P10: They often provide services such as fire departments, medical assistance, and police protection for the schools and their students
Premises.P11: They also provide funds for academic research
Premises.P12: While the money is not given to individual students, these contributions are not trivial
